revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Belkin |model=F7D4302 |revision=v1 |upc=722868757383 |asin=B003CJTNLI |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=Arcadyan |manuf_model=WG8017 |manuf_rev=F22 |est_release_date=03/24/2010 |fcc_date=02/23/2010 |fcc_id=K7SF7D4302V1 |ic_id=3623A-F7D4302V1 |pcb_id=141701620001J |type=wireless router |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1.5 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM4718A1;BCM4718A1KFBG, CS0950 P11, 950508 N1; |cpu1_cspeed=533 |fla1=8 |fla1_brand=Eon |fla1_model=EN29LV640B-90TIP |ram1=64 |ram1_brand=EtronTech |ram1_model=EM68B16CWPA-25H |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0 |expansion_usb_num=1 |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM4718A1;BCM4718A1KFBG, CS0950 P11, 950508 N1; |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi2_chip1_model=BCM43224;BCM43224KMLG, CE0952 P20, 953700 3; |wi2_802dot11_protocols=an |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL |wi2_txchains=2 |wi2_rxchains=2 |wi2_sstreams=2 |eth_cpu=true |sw_brand=Broadcom |sw_model=BCM5325E |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_speed=100M |wan_ports=1 |tp_firmware=DD-WRT, TomatoUSB (Toastman), FreshTomato |802dot11_protocols=abgn |default_ssid=Belkin.XXXX, Belkin.XXXX_5GHz |default_ssid_regex=^Belkin.[A-F0-9]{4}$,,, ^Belkin.[A-F0-9]{4}_5GHz$ |default_ip=192.168.2.1 |oui=94:44:52 |oui_eth=94:44:52 }} {{TagLine|Play Wireless Router}} :{{SupportPage|vendor=Belkin|vs_id_old=5133}}
"P/N: 141701620001J REV: 01" is silkscreened on the board.
The same hardware is used by the [[Belkin F7D8302]] ([http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=85964 mention on DD-WRT forums]).
The default SSIDs are '''Belkin.XXXX''' and '''Belkin.XXXX_5GHz''' where '''XXXX''' appears to '''5''' followed by :the last three hex digits of the wireless interface MAC address (though this could be incorrect). An example SSID set of SSIDs are '''Belkin.5BB8''' and '''Belkin.5BB8_5GHz''' with MAC 94:44:52:25:4B:B8.
===Links=== *{{TechInfoDepot|Belkin_F7D4302}} *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=70454 On the '''DD-WRT''' forums] (internal shots) *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=78042 ''Eko's initial support of partial support for the F7D4301''] *[http://www.myopenrouter.com/forum/thread/31156/Kong-Mod-Update-build-17600/http://www.myopenrouter.com/forum/thread/31156/Kong-Mod-Update-build-17600/ Supports DD-WRT Kong Mod] ([http://www.myopenrouter.com/article/23842/DD-WRT-Kong-Mod-Info/ main Kong Mod thread]) *[http://tomatousb.org/forum/t-300489/belkin-f7d4302-play-max-router-support-broadcom-based On the TomatoUSB forum] :This device seems to be working fine with the latest Toastman builds (as of 12/2012).
